He presses them together inward.
He bends his left big finger into the middle of his head finger.
The right big finger spreads out and straightens.
Don't bend them inward.
He presses his two wrists together.
He forms his two feet into a thong shape.

source_sentence: 乃右脚直立左膝曲在外。
translation: Standing with his right foot erect, he bends his left knee outward.
He bends his crossbow over his body to the left.

source_sentence: 以心印當右乳前勿著乳。
translation: He puts his mind-seal in front of his right breast and doesn't touch his breast.

source_sentence: 面作笑顏頭向右(手印與觀世音心印同唯身脚法用別)每月十五日洗浴於淨室。
translation: He makes a smile on his face and turns his head to the right (the hand signs are the same as Avalokitêśvara's mind signs, except for the body and feet.) On the fifteenth day of each month, he takes a bath in a clean room.
On the fifteenth day of every month, he washes his hands and makes the mental mudrā, reciting a mantra.

source_sentence: 滅四重五逆(此印是阿地多崛多師譯出)。
translation: It will extinguish the four grave and five heinous crimes (this seal is a translation by Ajita Kodo).
A thousand turns say.
"After reciting this dhāraṇī, bad karma will cease.
Up to seven times, the five heinous crimes are extinguished.
If you recite it ten times, no sin will be left unextinguished.

source_sentence: 十萬遍面見觀音種種莊嚴者。
translation: Those who recite it 100,000 times and see Avalokitêśvara's face in all its splendor will have their sins ceased.
When he first performs the ritual in seven days, he'll only be able to eat milk, milk, and cheese.

source_sentence: 惟得食乳糜蘇酪白餅粳米飯。
translation: He may eat only milk, milk and cheese, white cake, and millet and rice.
He mustn't eat salt, soy sauce, or vegetables.
On the last day, he mustn't eat.
For fifteen days and nights, he'll eat on an empty stomach.
There's no set number of incantations that he recites in front of the Buddha.
When he sees the image shake, he calls out, saying, "Good!
He calls out a verbal invocation, saying, "Good!
"It radiates brightly!

source_sentence: 復以真珠寶物安呪師頂上。
translation: He then puts a real pearl or something precious on the top of the curse master's head.
He then knew he had accomplished it.
After seeing Avalokitêśvara face to face.
He'll be able to fulfill all his good vows.

source_sentence: 又於睡眠中夢見觀音種種莊嚴者。
translation: Also, when he's asleep, he dreams that he sees Avalokitêśvara in all her splendor.
All good deeds are accomplished.
All bad actions are extinguished.
The reader of the vision will also attain the cessation of sins.
When he wants to travel east or west, he precepts his hand seven times and rubs it over his face.
First, he moistsens his hands seven times and rubs them over his face.

source_sentence: 所至之處無諸災橫若能清淨如法常誦不廢。
translation: There are no calamities or hardships wherever he goes, and if he can recite it consistently and without abandoning it, it'll be pure and according to the teaching.
They'll attain the first ground.

source_sentence: 若有女人能誦持者後成男子。
translation: If there's a woman who can recite it and memorize it, she'll later become a man.
She won't be re-acquired in the form of a woman like that.
First, he makes a stand, places offerings, and prepares it.

source_sentence: 然始誦呪其壇四面各長十六肘。
translation: Then, when the mantra is first recited, the altar is 16 cubits long on each of the four sides.
The four sides of the altar are each 16 cubits long, and it's made in a fourfold pattern.
The outer face of the altar is white, and the inner face is four colors.
Each is one layer resembling the shape of a wall.
That's eight layers.
They combine the five directions and colors, and the four sides open with a door.
The east, west, and north are the same as the west.
The one in the center doesn't need to have an open door.
There are eight large tile pots and four urns.
Fill them with water and insert cypress and tree branches.
Put the water jar and urn in the pot.

source_sentence: 作白餅粳米飯乳酪蘇蜜香果子等供養。
translation: He makes offerings of white bread, millet, rice, cream, sour cream, honey, scented fruit, and so forth.
There are sixteen sticks of lanterns.

source_sentence: 四門外各插十六隻未經用箭。
translation: Outside each of the four gates, he inserts 16 arrows that haven't been used yet.
Hanging five strands of ribbon on the arrows, he said.

source_sentence: 取佉陀羅木(紫檀木是)四枝。
translation: Take four sticks of khadira wood (this is purple sandalwood).
Two are five fingers long, and two are six fingers long.
It's nailed to the four corners of the altar.

source_sentence: 散種種時非時花於壇上。
translation: He scatters various flowers on the altar at different times.

source_sentence: 又取頗伽木(拘無子少者是)一千八百枚。
translation: He also takes 1,800 pieces of sphaṭika wood (kumuda is lesser).
Each is about a foot long.
Suppose you take a tile bowl or a copper bowl.
Rub this stick of wood with soap and milk.
Throwing one branch into the fire after the spell is repeated, he says.

source_sentence: 無佉陀羅木時(赤棗木代亦得)須畫一白色觀音聖者像。
translation: When there's no khadira wood (red jujube wood will do), you must draw a white image of Avalokitêśvara.
Do it according to the amount of strength you have.
It's also said in the previous explanation of the teaching.
'A thousand eons of accumulated karmic hindrances.'
When he recites it at once, they'll all be extinguished.
He'll attain the good roots gathered by a thousand buddhas.

source_sentence: 得背千劫流轉生老病死邊際。
translation: They'll be able to abandon a thousand eons of transmigration to the limits of birth, old age, illness, and death.

source_sentence: 捨此身已即見千轉輪聖王。
translation: After abandoning this body, he'll then see a thousand wheel-turning sage kings.
He'll always uphold the ten good qualities.
If someone wants to be born in the pure land of the buddhas.

source_sentence: 晝夜各三時誦二十一遍。
translation: He recites them twenty-one times each during the three hours of the day and night.
It lasts for thirty-one days, just as he wishes.

source_sentence: 即於夢中或見佛金色形像及菩薩形像(此是先相即知當生淨土)。
translation: In a dream, he might see a golden image of a buddha or an image of a bodhisattva (this is the first sign that tells him he'll be born in the Pure Land).
The above dhāraṇī and its functions are the same as those recited at Tong Shi Zongchi Temple.

source_sentence: 並是通師總持寺翻梵本出。
translation: It was translated from the Sanskrit edition at Zongji Temple by the master Tong Shi.

When he's about to burn it, he rubs the stalk of wood and the incense with the oil.
Put the oil on the wood stem and on top of the incense.
He burns them after having each one dhāraṇīd once.

source_sentence: 豫五月六月取牛糞陰乾。
translation: In the month of May and June, he takes cow dung and dries it.

source_sentence: 突婆香水和作泥作場身。
translation: Mix it with the perfumed water of the cow dung and make mud for the site itself.
Two elbows round, it's made into a site.
On top of the site, he places various flowers and incense.
In the winter months, when there are no flowers, he carves flowers to scent the site.
It's then perfumed with the land scent.
The master of the spell faces east.
He sits down and recites the Dharma accomplished exactly one thousand times.

source_sentence: 未呪之時用此呪水二十一遍。
translation: Before the spell is performed, he uses this spell twenty-one times with water.
He may take it seven times.

source_sentence: 呪水解污淨室道場佛堂洗身呪柳枝打病呪水治病並得。
translation: The water is used to relieve defilement in a clean room, a place of worship, a Buddha hall, a body wash, a willow branch to beat illness, and water to cure illness.
He uses this spell twenty-one times each.

source_sentence: 若能一生日別三時時別誦二十一遍。
translation: If you can recite it twenty-one times each during a lifetime and at three separate times of day, it will extinguish unfathomable sins and help you heal all diseases.

source_sentence: 滅罪不可思議通一切用。
translation: It will extinguish sins and is unfathomably versatile in all applications.

source_sentence: 千轉陀羅尼觀世音菩薩呪
translation: Dhāraṇī of a Thousand Turns Avalokitêśvara Bodhisattva Dhāraṇī
